recipe.title: How to Make Smores in a Microwave
steps: Break a graham cracker in half.
Break off a piece of chocolate, and place it on top of the graham cracker.
Place a marshmallow on top of the graham cracker.
Microwave the s'more on high for 15 seconds.
Take the plate out of the microwave, and place the other graham cracker half on top of the marshmallow.
Let the s'more cool for a few minutes before eating it.
descriptions: Place one of the graham cracker halves on a plate with a paper towel on it. Set the other graham cracker half aside. The paper towel will prevent the cracker from getting soggy. If you can't find any graham crackers, you can use another similar honey-cinnamon flavored cracker instead.
If you are using one of those large chocolate bars that have brick-like lines, use those lines as a guide. The chocolate should be a little smaller than the graham cracker.
Stand it up on the flat side, so that it doesn't roll off when you move the plate. Do not place the other graham cracker half on top just yet; you will do that at the end.

Put the plate with the s'more on it into the microwave, and heat it on high for 15 seconds. The chocolate will start to melt and become soft, and the marshmallow will puff up. If the marshmallow puffs up too much, heat the s'more at 5-second intervals. Let the marshmallow deflate before heating it again.
Press down on the s'more to seal it. Be careful not to press so hard that the graham cracker breaks.
S'mores are tasty while they are still hot, but they won't be much fun to eat if you burn your tongue on them!

descriptions: Place one of the graham cracker halves on a plate with a paper towel on it. Set the other graham cracker half aside. The paper towel will prevent the cracker from getting soggy. If you can't find any graham crackers, you can use another similar honey-cinnamon flavored cracker instead.
If you are using one of those large chocolate bars that have brick-like lines, use those lines as a guide. The chocolate should be a little smaller than the graham cracker.
Stand it up on the flat side, so that it doesn't roll off when you move the plate. Do not place the other graham cracker half on top just yet; you will do that at the end.

Put the plate with the s'more on it into the microwave, and heat it on high for 15 seconds. The chocolate will start to melt and become soft, and the marshmallow will puff up. Press down on the s'more to seal it. Be careful not to press so hard that the graham cracker breaks.
S'mores are tasty while they are still hot, but they won't be much fun to eat if you burn your tongue on them!

Put the plate with the s'more on it into the microwave, and heat it on high for 15 seconds. The chocolate will start to melt and become soft, and the marshmallow will puff up. Press down on the s'more to seal it. Be careful not to press so hard that the graham cracker breaks.
S'mores are tasty while they are still hot, but they won't be much fun to eat if you burn your tongue on them!

descriptions: Place one of the graham cracker halves on a plate with a paper towel on it. Set the other graham cracker half aside. The paper towel will prevent the cracker from getting soggy. If you can't find any graham crackers, you can use another similar honey-cinnamon flavored cracker instead.
If you are using one of those large chocolate bars that have brick-like lines, use those lines as a guide. The chocolate should be a little smaller than the graham cracker.
Stand it up on the flat side, so that it doesn't roll off when you move the plate. Do not place the other graham cracker half on top just yet; you will do that at the end.

Put the plate with the s'more on it into the microwave, and heat it on high for 15 seconds. The chocolate will start to melt and become soft, and the marshmallow will puff up. If the marshmallow puffs up too much, heat the s'more at 5-second intervals. Let the marshmallow deflate before heating it again.
Press down on the s'more to seal it. Be careful not to press so hard that the graham cracker breaks.
S'mores are tasty while they are still hot, but they won't be much fun to eat if you burn your tongue on them!

descriptions: Place one of the graham cracker halves on a plate with a paper towel on it. Set the other graham cracker half aside. The paper towel will prevent the cracker from getting soggy. If you can't find any graham crackers, you can use another similar honey-cinnamon flavored cracker instead.
If you are using one of those large chocolate bars that have brick-like lines, use those lines as a guide. The chocolate should be a little smaller than the graham cracker.
Stand it up on the flat side, so that it doesn't roll off when you move the plate. Do not place the other graham cracker half on top just yet; you will do that at the end.

Put the plate with the s'more on it into the microwave, and heat it on high for 15 seconds. The chocolate will start to melt and become soft, and the marshmallow will puff up. Press down on the s'more to seal it. Be careful not to press so hard that the graham cracker breaks.
S'mores are tasty while they are still hot, but they won't be much fun to eat if you burn your tongue on them!

Stand it up on the flat side, so that it doesn't roll off when you move the plate. Do not place the other graham cracker half on top just yet; you will do that at the end.

Put the plate with the s'more on it into the microwave, and heat it on high for 15 seconds. The chocolate will start to melt and become soft, and the marshmallow will puff up. If the marshmallow puffs up too much, heat the s'more at 5-second intervals. Let the marshmallow deflate before heating it again.
Press down on the s'more to seal it. Be careful not to press so hard that the graham cracker breaks.
S'mores are tasty while they are still hot, but they won't be much fun to eat if you burn your tongue on them!

Take the plate out of the microwave, and place the other graham cracker half on top of the marshmallow.

descriptions: Place one of the graham cracker halves on a plate with a paper towel on it. Set the other graham cracker half aside. The paper towel will prevent the cracker from getting soggy. If you can't find any graham crackers, you can use another similar honey-cinnamon flavored cracker instead.
If you are using one of those large chocolate bars that have brick-like lines, use those lines as a guide. The chocolate should be a little smaller than the graham cracker.
Stand it up on the flat side, so that it doesn't roll off when you move the plate. Do not place the other graham cracker half on top just yet; you will do that at the end.

Put the plate with the s'more on it into the microwave, and heat it on high for 15 seconds. The chocolate will start to melt and become soft, and the marshmallow will puff up. If the marshmallow puffs up too much, heat the s'more at 5-second intervals. Let the marshmallow deflate before heating it again.
Press down on the s'more to seal it. Be careful not to press so hard that the graham cracker breaks.
S'mores are tasty while they are still hot, but they won't be much fun to eat if you burn your tongue on them!

descriptions: Place one of the graham cracker halves on a plate with a paper towel on it. Set the other graham cracker half aside. The paper towel will prevent the cracker from getting soggy. If you can't find any graham crackers, you can use another similar honey-cinnamon flavored cracker instead.
If you are using one of those large chocolate bars that have brick-like lines, use those lines as a guide. The chocolate should be a little smaller than the graham cracker.
Stand it up on the flat side, so that it doesn't roll off when you move the plate. Do not place the other graham cracker half on top just yet; you will do that at the end.

Put the plate with the s'more on it into the microwave, and heat it on high for 15 seconds. The chocolate will start to melt and become soft, and the marshmallow will puff up. If the marshmallow puffs up too much, heat the s'more at 5-second intervals. Let the marshmallow deflate before heating it again.
Press down on the s'more to seal it. Be careful not to press so hard that the graham cracker breaks.
S'mores are tasty while they are still hot, but they won't be much fun to eat if you burn your tongue on them!

Stand it up on the flat side, so that it doesn't roll off when you move the plate. Do not place the other graham cracker half on top just yet; you will do that at the end.

Put the plate with the s'more on it into the microwave, and heat it on high for 15 seconds. The chocolate will start to melt and become soft, and the marshmallow will puff up. If the marshmallow puffs up too much, heat the s'more at 5-second intervals. Let the marshmallow deflate before heating it again.
Press down on the s'more to seal it. Be careful not to press so hard that the graham cracker breaks.
S'mores are tasty while they are still hot, but they won't be much fun to eat if you burn your tongue on them!

Stand it up on the flat side, so that it doesn't roll off when you move the plate. Do not place the other graham cracker half on top just yet; you will do that at the end.

Put the plate with the s'more on it into the microwave, and heat it on high for 15 seconds. The chocolate will start to melt and become soft, and the marshmallow will puff up. If the marshmallow puffs up too much, heat the s'more at 5-second intervals. Let the marshmallow deflate before heating it again.
Press down on the s'more to seal it. Be careful not to press so hard that the graham cracker breaks.
S'mores are tasty while they are still hot, but they won't be much fun to eat if you burn your tongue on them!

Stand it up on the flat side, so that it doesn't roll off when you move the plate. Do not place the other graham cracker half on top just yet; you will do that at the end.

Put the plate with the s'more on it into the microwave, and heat it on high for 15 seconds. The chocolate will start to melt and become soft, and the marshmallow will puff up. If the marshmallow puffs up too much, heat the s'more at 5-second intervals. Let the marshmallow deflate before heating it again.
Press down on the s'more to seal it. Be careful not to press so hard that the graham cracker breaks.
S'mores are tasty while they are still hot, but they won't be much fun to eat if you burn your tongue on them!

message.text: Take a piece of chocolate and put it on your cracker half. The chocolate should not be the same size or bigger than the graham cracker. Make sure that it is small, but not too small.
evidence: Break off a piece of chocolate, and place it on top of the graham cracker.

descriptions: Place one of the graham cracker halves on a plate with a paper towel on it. Set the other graham cracker half aside. The paper towel will prevent the cracker from getting soggy. If you can't find any graham crackers, you can use another similar honey-cinnamon flavored cracker instead.
If you are using one of those large chocolate bars that have brick-like lines, use those lines as a guide. The chocolate should be a little smaller than the graham cracker.
Stand it up on the flat side, so that it doesn't roll off when you move the plate. Do not place the other graham cracker half on top just yet; you will do that at the end.

Put the plate with the s'more on it into the microwave, and heat it on high for 15 seconds. The chocolate will start to melt and become soft, and the marshmallow will puff up. Press down on the s'more to seal it. Be careful not to press so hard that the graham cracker breaks.
S'mores are tasty while they are still hot, but they won't be much fun to eat if you burn your tongue on them!

Take the plate out of the microwave, and place the other graham cracker half on top of the marshmallow.

descriptions: Place one of the graham cracker halves on a plate with a paper towel on it. Set the other graham cracker half aside. The paper towel will prevent the cracker from getting soggy. If you can't find any graham crackers, you can use another similar honey-cinnamon flavored cracker instead.
If you are using one of those large chocolate bars that have brick-like lines, use those lines as a guide. The chocolate should be a little smaller than the graham cracker.
Stand it up on the flat side, so that it doesn't roll off when you move the plate. Do not place the other graham cracker half on top just yet; you will do that at the end.

Put the plate with the s'more on it into the microwave, and heat it on high for 15 seconds. The chocolate will start to melt and become soft, and the marshmallow will puff up. If the marshmallow puffs up too much, heat the s'more at 5-second intervals. Let the marshmallow deflate before heating it again.
Press down on the s'more to seal it. Be careful not to press so hard that the graham cracker breaks.
S'mores are tasty while they are still hot, but they won't be much fun to eat if you burn your tongue on them!

If you are using one of those large chocolate bars that have brick-like lines, use those lines as a guide. The chocolate should be a little smaller than the graham cracker.
Stand it up on the flat side, so that it doesn't roll off when you move the plate. Do not place the other graham cracker half on top just yet; you will do that at the end.

Put the plate with the s'more on it into the microwave, and heat it on high for 15 seconds. The chocolate will start to melt and become soft, and the marshmallow will puff up. If the marshmallow puffs up too much, heat the s'more at 5-second intervals. Let the marshmallow deflate before heating it again.
Press down on the s'more to seal it. Be careful not to press so hard that the graham cracker breaks.
S'mores are tasty while they are still hot, but they won't be much fun to eat if you burn your tongue on them!

Stand it up on the flat side, so that it doesn't roll off when you move the plate. Do not place the other graham cracker half on top just yet; you will do that at the end.

Put the plate with the s'more on it into the microwave, and heat it on high for 15 seconds. The chocolate will start to melt and become soft, and the marshmallow will puff up. If the marshmallow puffs up too much, heat the s'more at 5-second intervals. Let the marshmallow deflate before heating it again.
Press down on the s'more to seal it. Be careful not to press so hard that the graham cracker breaks.
S'mores are tasty while they are still hot, but they won't be much fun to eat if you burn your tongue on them!

message.text: Okay, I found regular marshmallows and placed it on the cracker. Now what, sir?

Stand it up on the flat side, so that it doesn't roll off when you move the plate. Do not place the other graham cracker half on top just yet; you will do that at the end.

Put the plate with the s'more on it into the microwave, and heat it on high for 15 seconds. The chocolate will start to melt and become soft, and the marshmallow will puff up. If the marshmallow puffs up too much, heat the s'more at 5-second intervals. Let the marshmallow deflate before heating it again.
Press down on the s'more to seal it. Be careful not to press so hard that the graham cracker breaks.
S'mores are tasty while they are still hot, but they won't be much fun to eat if you burn your tongue on them!

message.text: Well, I'm not sure if I did it right because the cracker broke.

Put the plate with the s'more on it into the microwave, and heat it on high for 15 seconds. The chocolate will start to melt and become soft, and the marshmallow will puff up. If the marshmallow puffs up too much, heat the s'more at 5-second intervals. Let the marshmallow deflate before heating it again.
Press down on the s'more to seal it. Be careful not to press so hard that the graham cracker breaks.
S'mores are tasty while they are still hot, but they won't be much fun to eat if you burn your tongue on them!

recipe.title: How to Make Smores in a Microwave
steps: Break a graham cracker in half.
Break off a piece of chocolate, and place it on top of the graham cracker.
Place a marshmallow on top of the graham cracker.
Microwave the s'more on high for 15 seconds.
Take the plate out of the microwave, and place the other graham cracker half on top of the marshmallow.
Let the s'more cool for a few minutes before eating it.
descriptions: Place one of the graham cracker halves on a plate with a paper towel on it. Set the other graham cracker half aside. The paper towel will prevent the cracker from getting soggy. If you can't find any graham crackers, you can use another similar honey-cinnamon flavored cracker instead.
If you are using one of those large chocolate bars that have brick-like lines, use those lines as a guide. The chocolate should be a little smaller than the graham cracker.
Stand it up on the flat side, so that it doesn't roll off when you move the plate. Do not place the other graham cracker half on top just yet; you will do that at the end.

Put the plate with the s'more on it into the microwave, and heat it on high for 15 seconds. The chocolate will start to melt and become soft, and the marshmallow will puff up. If the marshmallow puffs up too much, heat the s'more at 5-second intervals. Let the marshmallow deflate before heating it again.
Press down on the s'more to seal it. Be careful not to press so hard that the graham cracker breaks.
S'mores are tasty while they are still hot, but they won't be much fun to eat if you burn your tongue on them!

recipe.title: How to Make Smores in a Microwave
steps: Break a graham cracker in half.
Break off a piece of chocolate, and place it on top of the graham cracker.
Place a marshmallow on top of the graham cracker.
Microwave the s'more on high for 15 seconds.
Take the plate out of the microwave, and place the other graham cracker half on top of the marshmallow.
Let the s'more cool for a few minutes before eating it.
descriptions: Place one of the graham cracker halves on a plate with a paper towel on it. Set the other graham cracker half aside. The paper towel will prevent the cracker from getting soggy. If you can't find any graham crackers, you can use another similar honey-cinnamon flavored cracker instead.
If you are using one of those large chocolate bars that have brick-like lines, use those lines as a guide. The chocolate should be a little smaller than the graham cracker.
Stand it up on the flat side, so that it doesn't roll off when you move the plate. Do not place the other graham cracker half on top just yet; you will do that at the end.

Put the plate with the s'more on it into the microwave, and heat it on high for 15 seconds. The chocolate will start to melt and become soft, and the marshmallow will puff up. If the marshmallow puffs up too much, heat the s'more at 5-second intervals. Let the marshmallow deflate before heating it again.
Press down on the s'more to seal it. Be careful not to press so hard that the graham cracker breaks.
S'mores are tasty while they are still hot, but they won't be much fun to eat if you burn your tongue on them!

Take the plate out of the microwave, and place the other graham cracker half on top of the marshmallow.

descriptions: Place one of the graham cracker halves on a plate with a paper towel on it. Set the other graham cracker half aside. The paper towel will prevent the cracker from getting soggy. If you can't find any graham crackers, you can use another similar honey-cinnamon flavored cracker instead.
If you are using one of those large chocolate bars that have brick-like lines, use those lines as a guide. The chocolate should be a little smaller than the graham cracker.
Stand it up on the flat side, so that it doesn't roll off when you move the plate. Do not place the other graham cracker half on top just yet; you will do that at the end.

Put the plate with the s'more on it into the microwave, and heat it on high for 15 seconds. The chocolate will start to melt and become soft, and the marshmallow will puff up. If the marshmallow puffs up too much, heat the s'more at 5-second intervals. Let the marshmallow deflate before heating it again.
Press down on the s'more to seal it. Be careful not to press so hard that the graham cracker breaks.
S'mores are tasty while they are still hot, but they won't be much fun to eat if you burn your tongue on them!

Take the plate out of the microwave, and place the other graham cracker half on top of the marshmallow.
Let the s'more cool for a few minutes before eating it.
descriptions: Place one of the graham cracker halves on a plate with a paper towel on it. Set the other graham cracker half aside. The paper towel will prevent the cracker from getting soggy. If you can't find any graham crackers, you can use another similar honey-cinnamon flavored cracker instead.
If you are using one of those large chocolate bars that have brick-like lines, use those lines as a guide. The chocolate should be a little smaller than the graham cracker.
Stand it up on the flat side, so that it doesn't roll off when you move the plate. Do not place the other graham cracker half on top just yet; you will do that at the end.

Put the plate with the s'more on it into the microwave, and heat it on high for 15 seconds. The chocolate will start to melt and become soft, and the marshmallow will puff up. If the marshmallow puffs up too much, heat the s'more at 5-second intervals. Let the marshmallow deflate before heating it again.
Press down on the s'more to seal it. Be careful not to press so hard that the graham cracker breaks.
S'mores are tasty while they are still hot, but they won't be much fun to eat if you burn your tongue on them!

Place a marshmallow on top of the graham cracker.
Microwave the s'more on high for 15 seconds.
Take the plate out of the microwave, and place the other graham cracker half on top of the marshmallow.
Let the s'more cool for a few minutes before eating it.
descriptions: Place one of the graham cracker halves on a plate with a paper towel on it. Set the other graham cracker half aside. The paper towel will prevent the cracker from getting soggy. If you can't find any graham crackers, you can use another similar honey-cinnamon flavored cracker instead.
If you are using one of those large chocolate bars that have brick-like lines, use those lines as a guide. The chocolate should be a little smaller than the graham cracker.
Stand it up on the flat side, so that it doesn't roll off when you move the plate. Do not place the other graham cracker half on top just yet; you will do that at the end.

Put the plate with the s'more on it into the microwave, and heat it on high for 15 seconds. The chocolate will start to melt and become soft, and the marshmallow will puff up. If the marshmallow puffs up too much, heat the s'more at 5-second intervals. Let the marshmallow deflate before heating it again.
Press down on the s'more to seal it. Be careful not to press so hard that the graham cracker breaks.
S'mores are tasty while they are still hot, but they won't be much fun to eat if you burn your tongue on them!

message.text: It's so good! Where can I get more recipes like this?

Stand it up on the flat side, so that it doesn't roll off when you move the plate. Do not place the other graham cracker half on top just yet; you will do that at the end.

Put the plate with the s'more on it into the microwave, and heat it on high for 15 seconds. The chocolate will start to melt and become soft, and the marshmallow will puff up. If the marshmallow puffs up too much, heat the s'more at 5-second intervals. Let the marshmallow deflate before heating it again.
Press down on the s'more to seal it. Be careful not to press so hard that the graham cracker breaks.
S'mores are tasty while they are still hot, but they won't be much fun to eat if you burn your tongue on them!

message.text: As mentioned before, look for the lines on the chocolate bar. Once you have found the lines, break a piece of the chocolate bar based on the lines so you can have a good, clean piece to place on your cracker.

descriptions: Place one of the graham cracker halves on a plate with a paper towel on it. Set the other graham cracker half aside. The paper towel will prevent the cracker from getting soggy. If you can't find any graham crackers, you can use another similar honey-cinnamon flavored cracker instead.
If you are using one of those large chocolate bars that have brick-like lines, use those lines as a guide. The chocolate should be a little smaller than the graham cracker.
Stand it up on the flat side, so that it doesn't roll off when you move the plate. Do not place the other graham cracker half on top just yet; you will do that at the end.

Put the plate with the s'more on it into the microwave, and heat it on high for 15 seconds. The chocolate will start to melt and become soft, and the marshmallow will puff up. If the marshmallow puffs up too much, heat the s'more at 5-second intervals. Let the marshmallow deflate before heating it again.
Press down on the s'more to seal it. Be careful not to press so hard that the graham cracker breaks.
S'mores are tasty while they are still hot, but they won't be much fun to eat if you burn your tongue on them!

If the marshmallow puffs up too much, heat the s'more at 5-second intervals. Let the marshmallow deflate before heating it again.
Press down on the s'more to seal it. Be careful not to press so hard that the graham cracker breaks.
S'mores are tasty while they are still hot, but they won't be much fun to eat if you burn your tongue on them!

Stand it up on the flat side, so that it doesn't roll off when you move the plate. Do not place the other graham cracker half on top just yet; you will do that at the end.

Put the plate with the s'more on it into the microwave, and heat it on high for 15 seconds. The chocolate will start to melt and become soft, and the marshmallow will puff up. If the marshmallow puffs up too much, heat the s'more at 5-second intervals. Let the marshmallow deflate before heating it again.
Press down on the s'more to seal it. Be careful not to press so hard that the graham cracker breaks.
S'mores are tasty while they are still hot, but they won't be much fun to eat if you burn your tongue on them!

message.text: You can find more recipes at WikiHow! This one is available here: https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Smores-in-a-Microwave

Stand it up on the flat side, so that it doesn't roll off when you move the plate. Do not place the other graham cracker half on top just yet; you will do that at the end.

Put the plate with the s'more on it into the microwave, and heat it on high for 15 seconds. The chocolate will start to melt and become soft, and the marshmallow will puff up. If the marshmallow puffs up too much, heat the s'more at 5-second intervals. Let the marshmallow deflate before heating it again.
Press down on the s'more to seal it. Be careful not to press so hard that the graham cracker breaks.
S'mores are tasty while they are still hot, but they won't be much fun to eat if you burn your tongue on them!

message.text: That's very sweet of you. I hope you enjoy your smores.

recipe.title: How to Make Smores in a Microwave
steps: Break a graham cracker in half.
Break off a piece of chocolate, and place it on top of the graham cracker.

Take the plate out of the microwave, and place the other graham cracker half on top of the marshmallow.

descriptions: Place one of the graham cracker halves on a plate with a paper towel on it. Set the other graham cracker half aside. The paper towel will prevent the cracker from getting soggy. If you can't find any graham crackers, you can use another similar honey-cinnamon flavored cracker instead.
If you are using one of those large chocolate bars that have brick-like lines, use those lines as a guide. The chocolate should be a little smaller than the graham cracker.

Press down on the s'more to seal it. Be careful not to press so hard that the graham cracker breaks.
S'mores are tasty while they are still hot, but they won't be much fun to eat if you burn your tongue on them!

descriptions: Place one of the graham cracker halves on a plate with a paper towel on it. Set the other graham cracker half aside. The paper towel will prevent the cracker from getting soggy. If you can't find any graham crackers, you can use another similar honey-cinnamon flavored cracker instead.
If you are using one of those large chocolate bars that have brick-like lines, use those lines as a guide. The chocolate should be a little smaller than the graham cracker.
Stand it up on the flat side, so that it doesn't roll off when you move the plate. Do not place the other graham cracker half on top just yet; you will do that at the end.

Put the plate with the s'more on it into the microwave, and heat it on high for 15 seconds. The chocolate will start to melt and become soft, and the marshmallow will puff up. If the marshmallow puffs up too much, heat the s'more at 5-second intervals. Let the marshmallow deflate before heating it again.
Press down on the s'more to seal it. Be careful not to press so hard that the graham cracker breaks.
S'mores are tasty while they are still hot, but they won't be much fun to eat if you burn your tongue on them!

Put the plate with the s'more on it into the microwave, and heat it on high for 15 seconds. The chocolate will start to melt and become soft, and the marshmallow will puff up. If the marshmallow puffs up too much, heat the s'more at 5-second intervals. Let the marshmallow deflate before heating it again.
Press down on the s'more to seal it. Be careful not to press so hard that the graham cracker breaks.
S'mores are tasty while they are still hot, but they won't be much fun to eat if you burn your tongue on them!

recipe.title: How to Make Smores in a Microwave
steps: Break a graham cracker in half.
Break off a piece of chocolate, and place it on top of the graham cracker.
Place a marshmallow on top of the graham cracker.
Microwave the s'more on high for 15 seconds.
Take the plate out of the microwave, and place the other graham cracker half on top of the marshmallow.
Let the s'more cool for a few minutes before eating it.
descriptions: Place one of the graham cracker halves on a plate with a paper towel on it. Set the other graham cracker half aside. The paper towel will prevent the cracker from getting soggy. If you can't find any graham crackers, you can use another similar honey-cinnamon flavored cracker instead.
If you are using one of those large chocolate bars that have brick-like lines, use those lines as a guide. The chocolate should be a little smaller than the graham cracker.
Stand it up on the flat side, so that it doesn't roll off when you move the plate. Do not place the other graham cracker half on top just yet; you will do that at the end.

Put the plate with the s'more on it into the microwave, and heat it on high for 15 seconds. The chocolate will start to melt and become soft, and the marshmallow will puff up. If the marshmallow puffs up too much, heat the s'more at 5-second intervals. Let the marshmallow deflate before heating it again.
Press down on the s'more to seal it. Be careful not to press so hard that the graham cracker breaks.
S'mores are tasty while they are still hot, but they won't be much fun to eat if you burn your tongue on them!

steps: Break a graham cracker in half.
Break off a piece of chocolate, and place it on top of the graham cracker.
Place a marshmallow on top of the graham cracker.
Microwave the s'more on high for 15 seconds.
Take the plate out of the microwave, and place the other graham cracker half on top of the marshmallow.
Let the s'more cool for a few minutes before eating it.
descriptions: Place one of the graham cracker halves on a plate with a paper towel on it. Set the other graham cracker half aside. The paper towel will prevent the cracker from getting soggy. If you can't find any graham crackers, you can use another similar honey-cinnamon flavored cracker instead.
If you are using one of those large chocolate bars that have brick-like lines, use those lines as a guide. The chocolate should be a little smaller than the graham cracker.
Stand it up on the flat side, so that it doesn't roll off when you move the plate. Do not place the other graham cracker half on top just yet; you will do that at the end.

Put the plate with the s'more on it into the microwave, and heat it on high for 15 seconds. The chocolate will start to melt and become soft, and the marshmallow will puff up. If the marshmallow puffs up too much, heat the s'more at 5-second intervals. Let the marshmallow deflate before heating it again.
Press down on the s'more to seal it. Be careful not to press so hard that the graham cracker breaks.
S'mores are tasty while they are still hot, but they won't be much fun to eat if you burn your tongue on them!

message.text: Sorry, I'm a little nervous because of the broken cracker.

If you are using one of those large chocolate bars that have brick-like lines, use those lines as a guide. The chocolate should be a little smaller than the graham cracker.
Stand it up on the flat side, so that it doesn't roll off when you move the plate. Do not place the other graham cracker half on top just yet; you will do that at the end.

Put the plate with the s'more on it into the microwave, and heat it on high for 15 seconds. The chocolate will start to melt and become soft, and the marshmallow will puff up. If the marshmallow puffs up too much, heat the s'more at 5-second intervals. Let the marshmallow deflate before heating it again.
Press down on the s'more to seal it. Be careful not to press so hard that the graham cracker breaks.
S'mores are tasty while they are still hot, but they won't be much fun to eat if you burn your tongue on them!

If you are using one of those large chocolate bars that have brick-like lines, use those lines as a guide. The chocolate should be a little smaller than the graham cracker.
Stand it up on the flat side, so that it doesn't roll off when you move the plate. Do not place the other graham cracker half on top just yet; you will do that at the end.

Put the plate with the s'more on it into the microwave, and heat it on high for 15 seconds. The chocolate will start to melt and become soft, and the marshmallow will puff up. If the marshmallow puffs up too much, heat the s'more at 5-second intervals. Let the marshmallow deflate before heating it again.
Press down on the s'more to seal it. Be careful not to press so hard that the graham cracker breaks.
S'mores are tasty while they are still hot, but they won't be much fun to eat if you burn your tongue on them!

message.text: Awesome. Thank you so much, sir. If you were here in-person, I would love to enjoy these smores with you.

How do I do that?
Ok, I've broken the chocolate bar and marshmallow. What's next?
Got it, now what, sir?
Thanks, that sounds good. Now what?
Well, I'm not sure if I did it right because the cracker broke.
Sorry, I'm a little nervous because of the broken cracker.
That sounds good. I'm not worried anymore.
It's so good! Where can I get more recipes like this?
Hey! Thanks for the recipes!
I will, and I will look for recipes from you.
You too.
Thank you!

recipe.title: How to Make Smores in a Microwave

procedure.summary: Break a graham cracker in half.
procedure.description: Place one of the graham cracker halves on a plate with a paper towel on it. Set the other graham cracker half aside. The paper towel will prevent the cracker from getting soggy. If you can't find any graham crackers, you can use another similar honey-cinnamon flavored cracker instead.

procedure.summary: Break off a piece of chocolate, and place it on top of the graham cracker.
procedure.description: If you are using one of those large chocolate bars that have brick-like lines, use those lines as a guide. The chocolate should be a little smaller than the graham cracker.

procedure.summary: Place a marshmallow on top of the graham cracker.
procedure.description: Stand it up on the flat side, so that it doesn't roll off when you move the plate. Do not place the other graham cracker half on top just yet; you will do that at the end.

procedure.summary: Microwave the s'more on high for 15 seconds.
procedure.description: Put the plate with the s'more on it into the microwave, and heat it on high for 15 seconds. The chocolate will start to melt and become soft, and the marshmallow will puff up. If the marshmallow puffs up too much, heat the s'more at 5-second intervals. Let the marshmallow deflate before heating it again.

procedure.summary: Take the plate out of the microwave, and place the other graham cracker half on top of the marshmallow.
procedure.description: Press down on the s'more to seal it. Be careful not to press so hard that the graham cracker breaks.

procedure.summary: Let the s'more cool for a few minutes before eating it.
procedure.description: S'mores are tasty while they are still hot, but they won't be much fun to eat if you burn your tongue on them!
